general.headline: Software Engineer @ Visible Alpha | BITS Pilani
general.school: Birla Institute of Technology and Science, Pilani
general.description:
I am a Software Engineer, full stack developer who has mostly worked on back end applications, front end API services. I have worked on Microservices, .Net platform and have proficiency in C, Java, Python,  RabbitMQ, Celery, Elastic Stack(ELK), Redis.

Additional tools and technologies I work with: C#, Falcon, SQLAlchemy, Docker Containers, AWS, Nginx, Gunicorn, MySQL, Microsoft SQL Server, Consul, Knockout.js. 

I am currently working at Visible Alpha, a fin-tech company which offers multiple solutions, data and analytics platform for research, financial models etc. Here, I have worked in multiple projects like development in our legacy .Net platform, API development for new services, building new applications in microservices architecture. 

Before joining Visible Alpha, I have worked for Sabre Corporation as an Intern where I have worked in the development of media content management platform.

I love to experiment and prototype various technologies for problem solving and finding improvements. I have a strong engineering background with a Bachelor’s Degree focused in Computer Science from BITS Pilani.

jobs.description:
Visible Alpha is a fin tech company which provides end to end data and analytics solutions for buy side and sell side regarding research, financial models etc.

Here, I have worked in multiple projects like development in our legacy .Net platform, API development for new services, building new applications in micro-services architecture.

I have worked on API development in both the legacy .Net Platform and Python falcon architecture.I have also built the real time logging infrastructure in Python using Python Logging, Rsyslog and Elastic search stack.

I have also worked on  a performance oriented project 'Resource Tracking' which tracks and analyses all research resources consumed complete with its calculators serving a huge number of providers. Here, I was responsible for the caching layer implemented in Redis. I have also implemented the audit for transparency in the system processes using asynchronous message and task queues such as RabbitMQ and Celery.

Sabre Corporation is a travel technology company which provides many solutions to airline, hospitality and travel network industries like global distribution system etc. It provides many platforms , e-commerce solutions, data-driven analytics tools for these industries.

At Sabre, I have worked in the development of Visual Content Media Platform(VCMP) which serves content to the global distribution system. I have also written tools to incorporate data from web services into the platform.

jobs.description:
Sales Operations – Online Channel
•	Devised strategy to set up Online as an important channel for future retail in automotive business
•	Built Digital Sales team across showrooms; Trained & certified key manpower at dealerships
•	Designed & developed end-to-end process flow and business matrix to streamline online orders

Vendor Management
•	On-boarding channel partners; successfully handled key accounts including top auto portals 
•	Actively involved in commercial negotiations, defining the scope & formalizing partnerships
•	Collaborated with the cross-functional teams; implemented processes and performance matrix

Business Excellence
•	Worked with vendor to launch company’s web-platform & the launch of the Sustainability report
•	Performed comprehensive Gap-Analysis to develop a road-map Sustainability initiatives
•	Lead “Recycle & Reuse of PV modules scrap” project; business model to handle solar waste

Business Development
* Understanding the supply chain of Consumer durable industry & Distributor's value contribution
* Estimation of market size & supply chain financial requirement for Consumer durable distributors

My stint at NTPC Ltd. has been a wonderful journey of experiential learning. I had the opportunity to work through the challenging phase of the green field project to a commercially operated station. I worked on several projects that cut across departments.

August’11-July’12: As Graduate Engineer Trainee, the classroom teachings were coupled with regular plant visits. Some of the key learnings were: 
•	Growth of Power sector in India and NTPC’s contribution as a market leader
•	Attaining grid parity by matching demand and supply to ensure stable grid frequency
•	Handling and prioritizing operations and maintenance schedule during the shift hours

August’12-September’13: In my capacity as a Shift-in-charge in Coal Handling Plant operations, I got the opportunity to hone my leadership skills while managing and streamlining the operations processes in the Coal Handling Unit. Highlights of the tenure were:
•	Led a team of 100+ individuals responsible for Avg. daily generation of 19 MU of power 
•	Optimized processes to achieve an improved turnaround time for coal rakes by 45%
•	Appreciated by the management for achieving demurrage free turnaround of 235 coal rakes
•	Designed & implemented the monitoring system for machines; an annual saving of INR 3 Cr.
•	Worked on automation of coal handling system; 
•	Collaborated with BHEL for commissioning of Coal Handling Plant

October’13-June’14: In my capacity as an Assistant Manager, my last tenure at NTPC Ltd. was in the Coal coordination department. I was responsible for:
•	Handling 60% of annual expenses of the power plant as coal cost worth INR 1800 crore
•	Executing Fuel supply agreements & MOUs for 8.5 MMT of coal worth INR 3800 crore
•	Liaising with Coal India Limited and its subsidiaries to ensure uninterrupted coal supply
•	Minimizing slippage in coal grade supplied by CIL and its subsidiaries, reducing coal consumption
•	Moderating plant level meetings with Indian Railway representatives to settle annual accounts

Worked on "High-Speed Link Interface Development" project. The project includes Designing and RTL coding of digital part of serial link physical layer where I did hardware coding in VHDL and Verilog, Design optimization and functional verification by waveform analysis and writing test cases for behavioral model of the transmitter, which is a part LAN which the forms an integral part of Serial Link Physical layer. The project aimed at improving high bandwidth capabilities for mobile application to obtain low pin count combined with very good power efficiency.

schools.description: Molecular Parasitology and Vector Biology Research Lab.Malaria  is known to affect about 200-300 million people world-wide according to WHO report 2016.Due to drug resistance and inefficient vaccines, there is an urgent need of identification of potential novel drug targets .Our group is working on various hypothetical/putative proteins from Plasmodium spp. which are specifically targeted to Apicoplast i.e. an essential organelle present in parasite. Apicoplast is selected as a target organelle because this particular organelle is essential for parasite’s survival in its various life cycle stages due to the presence of certain important metabolic pathways If they are blocked through drug applications, it will be lethal for parasite. Another aspect on which we are focusing is on proteins involved in Apicoplast division. Equal distribution of Apicoplast during Plasmodium asexual division is mandatory for its survival. However, not much is explored regarding Apicoplast division.

schools.schoolName: The Maharaja Sayajirao University of Baroda
schools.description: My M.Sc. Project was to study infection strategy of C.  glabrata under supervision of Dr. Johannes  Manjrekar. In this particular project we focused on certain proteins which has Prion forming domains. Why C.glabrata? because C.glabrata is the second most common cause of candidiasis after C.albicans .Host cell adhesion of Candida comes under one of the virulence factors which causes pathogenesis. Yeast being a close relative of Candida, its various Adhesion related genes can be extrapolated to Candida spp. i.e. orthologs.  In yeast adhesion related proteins are involved ,there is one adhesion related gene FLO11 which in turn regulated by  MOT3. it is acting as transcription factor in S. cerevisiae that modulates the expression of many genes including FLO11.  Prion determining region already predicted in Mot3,hence [MOT3+] cells can show a variety of phenotypes related to alterations in translation fidelity.work focuses on virulence related changes induced by  [MOT3+] cells

schools.schoolName: Shree M &N Virani Science College , Rajkot , Gujarat
schools.description: My B.Sc. Project was on Isolation and Screening of Biosurfactant Producing Bacteria fromEnvironmental Soil Samples of Rajkot RegionBiosurfactants are valued microbial amphiphilic molecules with effective reducing surface tension &emulsification activity. Form the petrol & crude contaminated environmental soil sample, isolation andscreening of Biosurfactant producing bacteria is done. Emulsification index, haemolytic activity andCTAB agar plate methods were used to screen the capability of isolates for producing Biosurfactant.Studies were also carried out using diesel, petrol, kerosene and engine oil as hydrocarbon source.Results of the present study suggested that these isolates have potential to use in oil degradation studies. The future aspects of this study will be to proceed further the biochemical and molecularcharacterization of potent isolates, to investigate and define the purification and characterization strategy of biosurfactant .

general.description:
Radix Learning offers Top-Quality, Computer-based, Actionable Learning & Assessment Solutions. The Learning Solutions are based on the effective "Learn by Doing" methodology. The Assessment Solutions are "Task-Based" rather than the popular, but limited multiple-choice based assessments. 

Individual Learners --> Build strong competencies by using the Learning Lab and the Practice Lab. Make competency-building fun & effective.

Faculty --> Use the Assessment Lab to conduct task-based assessments, save enormous amounts of time, and reclaim your weekends to be spent with family.

Universities --> Adopt the Actionable Learning & Assessment Solutions to bring tremendous effectiveness and efficiency in the educational processes.

Companies --> Use the Actionable Assessment Solution to effectively determine the competencies of the workforce or choose the right talent for the right job.

If your organization wants to implement strong, effective, computer-based assessment of competencies going beyond the simple MCQs, look no further. Radix Learning can implement bespoke, top-of-the-line  actionable assessment solutions.

Earlier, I served as CEO of Ascendum Systems (formerly AnswerPal) during March 2000 and Dec 2006. I have also served as Professor of Computer Science and Dean of Distance Learning at the prestigious Birla Institute of Technology & Science (BITS) in Pilani, India - considered to be among the top 5 universities for higher learning in India. Radix Learning's products derive its strength from my research and development at BITS, Pilani.

I also served as Director & Secretary on the board of the International Board of Standards for Training, Performance and Instruction (www.ibstpi.org). This helped polish my expertise in learning and assessments by working closely with top experts from academia and industry.

ACTION ===>> Take a look at www.radixlearning.com and take a demo to experience the power of Radix Learning's Actionable Learning & Assessment!

general.headline: Building a Global Startup Ecosystem for BITSians
general.school: Birla Institute of Technology and Science, Pilani
general.description:
Connect. Share. Grow with BITSian entrepreneurial eco-system.

About the Initiative: BITS2STARTUP@GLOBAL

Mission: Catch-them-young, Guide-them-right and Make-them-big.

Objective: To serve as a common platform for BITSian entrepreneurs, mentors, investors and other stakeholders in the start-up ecosystem to connect and help each other in every possible way anytime, anywhere.

How does this work: Every city has a BITSian Startup City Hub where the BITSians meet once a month to network with like-minded people who are starting out in their city to form a cohesive local community of BITSian entrepreneurs. The city chapters further would be connected to the National Hub and the Global Hub forming a big community boosting start-up ecosystem worldwide.

Features:

1. It will enable BITSians in seeking help for all kinds of challenges faced while starting up from BITSIAN's globally. Right from hiring to funding, it would build a bridge between budding entrepreneurs, investors, mentors and potential resources.

2. It will serve as a platform to connect to BITSians in this space globally and locally in each of the individual chapters.

3. It will keep everyone apprised about the updates in BITSian startup ecosystem, be it the latest news, events and activities.

So what do you need to do? 

Register as a member with your City Network of BITS Startup Hub and be a part of this community. Volunteer to set up the chapters in your city and be a part of the History-in-making!

Email - bit2startup.global@gmail.com

Social Media 
------------------

https://twitter.com/BITS2STARTUP

general.headline: Professor (Cognitive Neuroscience Lab) and Associate Dean, Alumni Relations at BITS Pilani K K Birla Goa Campus
general.school: BITS PILANI K K BIRLA GOA CAMPUS
general.description:
Dr. Baths obtained his B. Sc in Zoology from Ravenshaw University, Orissa and M.Sc. in Bioinformatics from the Orissa University of Agriculture and Technology, Orissa. He completed his Ph.D. Degree in Science from BITS-Pilani K K Birla Goa Campus in the year 2011. After which he joined the Department of Biological Sciences as an Assistant Professor. He then obtained an MBA from Goa Institute of Management.
His research areas include Neural Signal Processing, Machine Learning, Pattern Recognition and  Bioinformatics. A Brain-Computer Interface (BCI) is of great benefit to the differently abled, as it allows those with restricted freedom of movement to perform various actions which enable them to live an uncompromised, independent life. Such BCIs are possible by capturing and analysing electroencephalography (EEG) based potential responses to various stimuli. BCIs can be used for a host of activities, including cursor control, with spellers, to control wheelchairs and for home automation and control of various devices. A novel BCI-based home automation system and smart wheel chair that works with two responses - Steady State Visually Evoked Potential (SSVEP) and the eye-blink artifact. These two responses together facilitate a robust and efficient system that can serve the largest section of society to varying degrees.

WANT SMARTPHONES TO BECOME POS (POINT OF SALE) DEVICES OR DEBIT OR CREDIT CARDS ANYWHERE IN THE WORLD?

WANT SMARTPHONES TO ‘DISCOVER’ KLOZEST OFFLINE BRICKS AND MORTAR MERCHANTS AUTOMATICALLY?

WANT SMARTPHONES TO MAKE SECURED OFFLINE BRICKS AND MORTAR PAYMENTS WITHOUT ‘INTERNET’? 

klozest.com/pay technology stack is for Mobile Wallets and Smartphone Manufacturers. The mobile payment wallets integrated with www.klozest.com/pay technology stack don't NEED: 
NO Internet, 
NO scanning of QR Codes,
NO Wifi,
NO NFC chipsets in phones,
NO Camera in phones,
NO Bluetooth pairing,
NO GPS location tracking constantly,
NO additional hardware,
NO infrastructure from local wireless carrier,
NO nothing at the time of sending and/or receiving contactless payments to / from klozest offline users (from within 40-50 ft).

IMAGINE, if offline bricks and mortar merchants receive mobile payments without INTERNET or their customers needing INTERNET or having to SCAN QR CODES at the time of making contactless mobile payments; will other neighboring merchants use mobile wallets that require INTERNET or their customers needing INTERNET or having to SCAN QR CODES to make payments?...........NOPE, NEVER!

Read more in this Techinasia article https://www.techinasia.com/internet-problem-mobile-wallet-payments? on klozest.com/pay.

general.school: Indian Institute of Management Bangalore
general.description:
Hello,

I am Tanmayee, a PGDM student at IIM Bangalore. A Mechanical Engineering graduate from BITS PIlani, I hail from Mumbai.

I worked for a year as a Young Manufacturing Professional at Hindalco Industries Limited. I was responsible for studying various plant departments and making recommendations in productivity and sustainability improvements. I prepared Standard Working Instructions (SWIs) for various activities in Mechanical Maintenance. I was also involved in Six Sigma and Asset Reliability projects.

I have been a DAAD exchange student to TU Braunschweig, Germany, where I worked on the Indo-German Collaboration project '3-Cycle'. This involved a Life Cycle Assessment of 3D-printing plastic waste recycling, to produce 3D-printing filament again for further use. I studied the quality of such PLA and ABS filament, comparing it with industrial filament. This process proved to be environmentally beneficial to conventional production.

I have interned at PRS Permacel Pvt Ltd, where I worked out a Low Cost Automation system, which could effectively replace the employment of labour and increase profits. During my stint, I undertook a History Card Analysis for every machine in the manufacturing unit, which could be used to determine its optimum age. I further created a Database of the Warehouse, tracking the inventory in place, to facilitate future orders.

My flair for Event Planning, Journalism and Analysis is substantiated with my school and college experience. I have recently developed a liking for Case Studies, and wish to improve my skills in this field as well.
